page.title: 15R.LEVEN-INDUSTRIAL IMPACT
page.content: WALKERTON ON THE BANKS OF THE LEVEN IS A LONG-DERELICT BLEACHFIELDS AND FLAXMILLS.WE REPORT ON ITS PRESENT STATE. " THE GREY AND BROWN HEAPS OF RUBBLE ARE A CONTRAST TO THE GREENERY ON THE SURROUNDING SLOPES WITH YOUNG BIRCH TREES GROWING IN THE GAPS OF COLLAPSED WALLS.OLD GATES CREAK IN THE WIND.MAN HAS ATTACKED THE BUILDINGS.VANDALS HAVE GRAFITTIED THE WALLS WITH SPRAY PAINT.THE SITE IS NOW A DUMP.WE DISCOVERED BARRELS,RUSTY WIRE,OIL CANS GLASS,OLD CLOTHES.WORST OF ALL,SOMEONE HAS DUMPED A FRIDGE DOOR.YET WE FOUND NO OLD MACHINERY FROM PROSPEROUS DAYS. WAS IT DISMANTLED AND SOLD? THE VEGETATION IS SLOWLY TAKING OVER.TREES,WILLOW HERB,GRASSES AND BUTTERCUPS ARE SWALLOWING UP THIS DERELICTION"
